title: Great dagger
data:
| ) [![Great dagger.png](/images/4/42/Great_dagger.png)](/wiki/File:Great_dagger.png) |                                                          |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                | great dagger                                             |
| Appearance                                                                          | great dagger                                             |
| Damage vs. small                                                                    | 1d6                                                      |
| Damage vs. large                                                                    | 1d7                                                      |
| To-hit bonus                                                                        | +2                                                       |
| Weapon skill                                                                        | [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                          |
| Size                                                                                | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")              |
| Base price                                                                          | 500 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                              | [10](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                              |
| Material                                                                            | [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal")                             |

A **great dagger** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a one-handed weapon that uses the [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), and can be used in melee and thrown. It is made of [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal").

[The Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa](/wiki/The_Great_Dagger_of_Glaurgnaa "The Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") great dagger.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

  - [1.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [1.2 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [1.3 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [2 Description](#Description)
  - [2.1 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM_2)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 References](#References)

## Generation

The generation methods for great daggers depend on the variant.

### SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, great daggers are not randomly generated, though they can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for and appear in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") an [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger") or [dark elven dagger](/wiki/Dark_elven_dagger_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven dagger (SLASH'EM)") will produce a great dagger.

### SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, great daggers can be randomly generated like other weapons, and weapon [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and general stores can stock great daggers.

### Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, great daggers are not randomly generated, though they can be wished for and appear in bones.

Upgrading a [stake](/wiki/Stake "Stake") will produce a great dagger. A great dagger can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [parazonium](/wiki/Parazonium "Parazonium") and a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife").

## Description

The great dagger cannot be stacked normally like other daggers, which is done intentionally[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) - a stack of great daggers can be generated by other means (e.g. upgrading).

Upgrading a great dagger will produce an elven dagger or dark elven dagger.

### Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, upgrading a great dagger will produce an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger").

## Strategy

The great dagger is the strongest type of dagger available in SLASH'EM and its variants - it can serve as both a solid melee and projectile weapon, and its base material is naturally erodeproof.

It is possible to generate a stack of great daggers by upgrading a stack of elven/dark elven daggers - a dagger thrown from this stack will not be able to re-merge into the original stack.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [SLASH'EM mailing list @ lists.sourceforge.net - Release plans (0.0.7E7F3 and 0.0.8E0F1)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805201036/http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.games.roguelike.nethack.slashem.devel/72)

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Great dagger

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)
Name great dagger
Appearance great dagger
Damage vs. small 1d6
Damage vs. large 1d7
To-hit bonus +2
Weapon skill dagger
Size one-handed
Base price 500 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 10
Material metal

A great dagger is a type of weapon that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the dagger skill, and can be used in melee and thrown. It is made of metal.

The Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa is an artifact great dagger.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
    • 1.1 SLASH'EM
    • 1.2 SlashTHEM
    • 1.3 Hack'EM
  • 2 Description
    • 2.1 Hack'EM
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 References

Generation

The generation methods for great daggers depend on the variant.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, great daggers are not randomly generated, though they can be wished for and appear in bones.

Upgrading an elven dagger or dark elven dagger will produce a great dagger.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, great daggers can be randomly generated like other weapons, and weapon shops and general stores can stock great daggers.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, great daggers are not randomly generated, though they can be wished for and appear in bones.

Upgrading a stake will produce a great dagger. A great dagger can be created at a forge by combining a parazonium and a knife.

Description

The great dagger cannot be stacked normally like other daggers, which is done intentionally[1] - a stack of great daggers can be generated by other means (e.g. upgrading).

Upgrading a great dagger will produce an elven dagger or dark elven dagger.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, upgrading a great dagger will produce an orcish dagger.

Strategy

The great dagger is the strongest type of dagger available in SLASH'EM and its variants - it can serve as both a solid melee and projectile weapon, and its base material is naturally erodeproof.

It is possible to generate a stack of great daggers by upgrading a stack of elven/dark elven daggers - a dagger thrown from this stack will not be able to re-merge into the original stack.

References

  1. ↑ SLASH'EM mailing list @ lists.sourceforge.net - Release plans (0.0.7E7F3 and 0.0.8E0F1)

A '''great dagger''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the [[dagger]] [[skill]], and can be used in melee and thrown. It is made of [[metal]].

[[The Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa]] is an [[artifact weapon|artifact]] great dagger.

==Generation==
The generation methods for great daggers depend on the variant.

===SLASH'EM===
In SLASH'EM, great daggers are not randomly generated, though they can be [[wish]]ed for and appear in [[bones]].

[[Upgrading]] an [[elven dagger]] or [[Dark elven dagger (SLASH'EM)|dark elven dagger]] will produce a great dagger.

===SlashTHEM===
In SlashTHEM, great daggers can be randomly generated like other weapons, and weapon [[shop]]s and general stores can stock great daggers.

===Hack'EM===
In Hack'EM, great daggers are not randomly generated, though they can be wished for and appear in bones.

Upgrading a [[stake]] will produce a great dagger. A great dagger can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[parazonium]] and a [[knife]].

==Description==
The great dagger cannot be stacked normally like other daggers, which is done intentionally<ref>[http://web.archive.org/web/20140805201036/http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.games.roguelike.nethack.slashem.devel/72 SLASH'EM mailing list @ lists.sourceforge.net - Release plans (0.0.7E7F3 and 0.0.8E0F1)]</ref> - a stack of great daggers can be generated by other means (e.g. upgrading).

Upgrading a great dagger will produce an elven dagger or dark elven dagger.

===Hack'EM===
In Hack'EM, upgrading a great dagger will produce an [[orcish dagger]].

==Strategy==
The great dagger is the strongest type of dagger available in SLASH'EM and its variants - it can serve as both a solid melee and projectile weapon, and its base material is naturally erodeproof.

It is possible to generate a stack of great daggers by upgrading a stack of elven/dark elven daggers - a dagger thrown from this stack will not be able to re-merge into the original stack.
